Class SchedulingDataWindowPaneController

  • java.lang.Object
    • SchedulingDataWindowPaneController
  • public class SchedulingDataWindowPaneController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for handling the event and functionality for the Scheduling data Window pane. This class links to SchedulingDataWindowPane.FXML using @FXML, OnAction, fx:id and fx:controller.
    Author:
    Dakota Ray Tominus

    • Constructor Detail

      • SchedulingDataWindowPaneController

        public SchedulingDataWindowPaneController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        This method runs everytime the pane is loaded. Toggles the all scheduling toggle. Populates scheduling data. Sets up a listener. Populates the combo boxes. Sets up the page for a new appointment.

      • viewCustomers

        private void viewCustomers()
        This method is used to set up the Customer data scene. Opens a new Scheduling data window pane using the scene manager. catches IOException e and prints the stack trace.

      • addAppointment

        private void addAppointment()
        This method is used to set the page up for the next schedule to be added. Clears all fields. Sets the next appointment ID to the appointment id field. Focuses on the appointment title field.

      • saveAppointmentData

        private void saveAppointmentData()
        This method is used to save the appointment data to the database. Validates the user input. If successful insertion, clears the fields and repopulates the data table. Alerts user to addition.

      • deleteAppointment

        private void deleteAppointment()
        This method is used to delete an appointment from the database. Checks if the selection is empty. Evaluates the success of the deletion. If successful alerts the user, clears the fields and repopulates the Schedule data table. Alerts user if no selection has been made.

      • getReportAppointments

        private void getReportAppointments()
        This method is used to set up the Appointments report scene. Opens a new Appointment Report Window Pane. catches IOException e and prints the stack trace.

      • getReportContactSchedule

        private void getReportContactSchedule()
        This method is used to set up the Contact Schedule report scene. Opens a new Contact Schedule Report Window Pane. catches IOException e and prints the stack trace.

      • getReportCustomerHistory

        private void getReportCustomerHistory()
        This method is used to set up the Customer history report scene. Opens a new Customer Scheduling History Report Window Pane. catches IOException e and prints the stack trace.

      • openJavaDoc

        private void openJavaDoc()
        This method is used to open the JavaDoc. Uses the IOHelper class to open the JavaDoc in a Browser window.

      • populateSchedulingData

        private void populateSchedulingData()
        This method is used to populate the scheduling data table. Gets the appointments from the database using the appointment helper class. Uses the toggle to discern how much of the data to pull. Fills the table with the results, using the IOHelper.

      • setTableListener

        private void setTableListener()
        This method is used to set up a table listener on the scheduling data table. Listener will listen for a selection, and fill in the selected appointment data to the corresponding text fields. *** LAMBDA EXPRESSION*** This lambda expression simplifies the code while setting up much needed functionality.

      • radioButtonSelected

        private void radioButtonSelected​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        This method is used to toggle radio buttons. Adds the scenes radio buttons to an observable list and send them to the IOHelper class to be toggled. Repopulates the scheduling data based on the toggled radio button.
        Parameters:
        e - Action event of which the radio toggling occurred.

      • populateComboBoxes

        private void populateComboBoxes()
        This method is used to populate all initially populated combo boxes. Calls methods to populate combo boxes. ADD NEW COMBO BOX POPULATION METHODS HERE.***

      • populateContactComboBox

        private void populateContactComboBox()
        This method is used to populate the Contact combo box. Gets all contacts from the database using the contact helper class. populates contact combo box with results.

      • populateTypeComboBox

        private void populateTypeComboBox()
        This method is used to populate the type combo box. Gets all type from the database static class. populates contact combo box with results.

      • populateCustomerComboBox

        private void populateCustomerComboBox()
        This method is used to populate the Customer combo box. Gets all customers from the database using the customer helper class. populates customer combo box with results.

      • populateUserComboBox

        private void populateUserComboBox()
        This method is used to populate the user combo box. Gets all user from the database using the user helper class. populates contact combo box with results.

      • populateTimeComboBox

        private void populateTimeComboBox​(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> times)
        This method is used to populate the Times combo boxes. Generates times. populates contact combo box with results as it goes along.
        Parameters:
        times - The time combo box to be populated.

      • clearAppointmentDataFields

        private void clearAppointmentDataFields()
        This method is used to clear the Appointment data fields. Calls a method to reset the combo boxes. Sets all the text and text fields to an empty string.

      • resetComboBoxes

        private void resetComboBoxes()
        This method resets the combo boxes. Calls IOHelper class to clear combo boxes. Resets the corresponding error text.

      • emptyDatePickers

        private void emptyDatePickers()
        This method empties the date pickers. Sets the values to null.

      • fillInSelectedAppointmentData

        private void fillInSelectedAppointmentData()
        This method is used to fill in the selected appointment data to the appointment data fields using the IO Helper class. Checks if the scheduling table selection is empty and cancels the operation if true. Clears all appointment data fields.

      • fillInComboBoxes

        private void fillInComboBoxes()
        This method is used to fill in appointment data to the combo boxes. Uses the IOHelper class to set the appointments data into the corresponding combo boxes. ADD NEW COMBO BOX FILL METHODS HERE ***

      • fillDatePickers

        private void fillDatePickers()
        This method is used to fill in the date pickers using the selected appointments data. Sets the date format. Sets the date format to use the default locale. Sets the start and end date values.

      • nextId

        private java.lang.String nextId()
        This method is used to get the hypothetical next ID from the database. Uses the Appointment Helper class to get the next ID.
        Returns:
        String representation of the next ID.

      • setNextAppointmentId

        private void setNextAppointmentId​(java.lang.String nextId)
        This method is used to set the next appointment id. Uses the given string to set the appointment ID text field, includes message about it being generated.
        Parameters:
        nextId - The string representation of the next hypothetical appointment ID.

      • focusOnAppointmentTitle

        private void focusOnAppointmentTitle()
        This method is used to focus on the appointment title field. Uses IOHelper to focus on the appointment title field.

      • validateAppointmentData

        private boolean validateAppointmentData()
        This method is used to validate the user input data for the appointment, and display error where appropriate. Sets up a boolean isValid to keep track of validation throughout method. Calls individual validation methods from the IOHelper class. sets isValid to false if any validation fails. Returns true if all data is valid.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of whether or no all data was validated successfully.
